main event: A civilian in Great Neck, New York reported a ground-radar observation of two unidentified aerial objects with erratic and evasive courses in November 1957. The observation lasted for 50 minutes, and the description provided was inconclusive.
interesting points: The observation was of two aerial objects described as the size of an apple and a grapefruit, yellowish-white in color and with a slight tail like comet, reddish in color.
The objects exhibited erratic behavior, including one stopping while the other turned right and left before disappearing.
The observation was made at 2300 hours on August 22, 1952, in Great Neck, NY.
The source of the report was a civilian, and the report indicated that the nature of the phenomenon was difficult to ascertain.
The reported observation lasted for 50 minutes, indicating a prolonged and detailed sighting.
